<<<code>>>: You can use the InputStream.available() method to check how much data is available to be read from the stream. Then you can use the InputStream.read(byte[] b, int off, int len) method to read a portion of the stream into the given byte array. This way you can read the file in chunks and avoid exhausting the memory.
<<<explanation>>>: Instead of reading the entire file into memory at once, you can read it in chunks using the available() method and read() method. This way you can avoid reading too much data into memory at once and potentially exhausting your memory. The available() method returns the number of bytes that can be read from the stream without blocking, and the read() method reads a portion of the stream into the given byte array. You can use these methods to read the file in chunks and compare the contents.
